summary: Invisible Britain: Telling the stories of those so often overlooked
title: Invisible Britain: Telling the stories of those so often overlooked
excerpt: With a foreword by actor Michael Sheen, a new book of portraits and interviews gives a voice to people affected by social issues such as austerity, Brexit, deindustrialisation, nationalism and cuts to public services.

tags: michael sheen wouldnt have done it
summary: I can think of nothing bad to say about Michael Sheen. What bad is there to say about a man who’s wife cheated on him and his...
body: I can think of nothing bad to say about Michael Sheen. What bad is there to say about a man who’s wife cheated on him and his response was “That’s okay. I can’t be with you anymore but I’ll still be there for you and the baby”? All his exes still love him AND each other. Like, this dude is playing an angel for a reason.

reblog.comment: I can think of nothing bad to say about Michael Sheen. What bad is there to say about a man who’s wife cheated on him and his response was “That’s okay. I can’t be with you anymore but I’ll still be there for you and the baby”? All his exes still love him AND each other. Like, this dude is playing an angel for a reason.

trail.content_raw: I can think of nothing bad to say about Michael Sheen. What bad is there to say about a man who’s wife cheated on him and his response was “That’s okay. I can’t be with you anymore but I’ll still be there for you and the baby”? All his exes still love him AND each other. Like, this dude is playing an angel for a reason.
trail.content: I can think of nothing bad to say about Michael Sheen. What bad is there to say about a man who’s wife cheated on him and his response was “That’s okay. I can’t be with you anymore but I’ll still be there for you and the baby”? All his exes still love him AND each other. Like, this dude is playing an angel for a reason.

blog.name: moviemosaics
blog.title: Movie Mosaics
blog.description: My name is Miles and I like movies! Posted here are a collection of photo grids from movies that I feel are particularly visually interesting. My hope is that by looking at these shots, one can get a sense of the film's style and an appreciation for the way we use aesthetics to tell story through the medium of film. Follow at instagram.com/moviemosaics

blog.name: haslemere
blog.title: Dwell in possibility...
blog.description:
Hi! Thiis is my fan blog. 
@thatdanstevens @haslemere1 I love a character who is stridently confident yet easily confused. (my favorite tweet...)
 "Sometimes you can know too much. Of all people I know this to be true. Ignorance is bliss. Knowledge is power. Which would you prefer." Stef Penney The Invisible Ones 
"What would Henry James have made of us, I wonder?" Nick replies..."He'd have been very kind to us, he'd have said how wonderful and how beautiful we were, he'd have given us incredibly subtle things to say, and we wouldn't have realized until just before the end that he'd seen right through us." Alan Hollinghurst The Line of Beauty 
“They did not talk about the larger present, so circumscribed, so uncontrollable. Their little present was two bodies and a bed, and that was the entirety of time and place: them, there, in their little room, awkward, laughing, happy, warm, tentative, surrendering, overwhelmed, alarmed, astounded, shivering, subsiding, asleep, awake, getting the hang of it, learning, loving, redeemed. Happy.” ― Louisa Young, My Dear I Wanted to Tell You 
Hello You will find this blog dedicated to the Great War Centenary with images and articles I find relevant. I love history, architecture, archaeology and so those also be blogged prominently. 
I adore Dan Stevens and will create, reblog, and generally wax lyrical about him. I believe he's a most excellent actor, full of charm and snark, and I wish him nothing but success. ...
I will defend Beauty and the Beast for all eternity,
LEGION is epic!
My other current favorite TV shows are Game of Thrones, The Americans, Man in the High Castle, Shetland, and Grey's Anatomy. 
Viggo Mortensen and Douglas Henshall are my secret honies. 
I also love Richard Armitage most dearly. 
I love Broadway.
I love Hamilton.
I love Raul Esparza.
I think very highly of Michael Fassbender (erm...yeah), Gael Garcia Bernal, Clive Owen, Hayley Atwell, Audra McDonald, Hattie Morahan, and Emma Thompson. 
My OTP is (!) Mary x Matthew (Downton Abbey) and that will never change. Therefore expect a lot of MM love from me. Look around and enjoy!!

summary: Apostle: A Promising Religious Horror That Should've Been a Miniseries
title: Apostle: A Promising Religious Horror That Should've Been a Miniseries
body:
Apostle: A Promising Religious Horror That Should’ve Been a Miniseries

Every once in a while, a horror movie comes along that blows away audiences and critics alike. These films are nearly flawless, making perfect use of scares, genre conventions, plotting, character development, cinematography, and score to weave a bewitching triumph of filmmaking that both expands and transcends the genre.

Unfortunately, Netflixs’s Apostleis not one of these films. But damn, I had…

View On WordPress

summary:
Richard Nixon:  Look, when you're in office you gotta do a lot of things 
sometimes that are not always in the strictest sense...
caption:
Richard Nixon:  Look, when you’re in office you gotta do a lot of things sometimes that are not always in the strictest sense of the law, legal, but you do them because they’re in the greater interest of the nation.

David Frost: Alright wait, wait just so I understand correctly, are you really saying that in certain situations the President can decide whether it’s in the best interest of the nation and then do something illegal…

Richard Nixon: I’m saying that when the President does it, that means it’s *not* illegal!

David Frost: I’m sorry?

reblog.comment:

David Frost: I’m sorry?
